Hey, guys. I'll post here a solution for people whom as me use windows 8 32bit. 
1) Create an acoount on steam and download any free game 
2) Copy steam_api.dll and steam_appid.ini from the GAME folder to Fieldrunners 2 folder 
3) Copy steamclient.dll from Steam Folder to FieldRunners 2 folder 
4) Edit steam_appid.ini on notepad and use the 215710 instead of any code written there. 
5) Open and log in on steam 
6) Play the game. It's worked for me and i'm sure it will work for you. 
7) Pass foward the information
You'll always need the steam opened to play

Has anyone figured out how to copy the game save between PCs? I installed on one system and played a lot, unlocking half the game. Now I want to play on another PC, but copying the save files doesn't work. I copied the entire game dir and the whole userdata folder with the game's ID (215710), but starting the game just overwrites the save file with a new one, starting the game over with no progress.

for anyone who faced this error on Win8 64-bit : "the procedure entry point create interface could not be located in the dynamic link library c:GamesFieldRunners 2steam_api.dll"

1) install latest version of steam and login with your account : http://store.steampowered.com/about/
2) goto the steam app folder : C:Program Files (x86)Steam , and copy all DLL files and paste them in the game folder next to the .exe file and overwrite any exists file , that's WORKS PERFECT for me !

Finally found a solution
see here:
http://steamcommunity.com/app/215710/discussions/1/864956555063225407/#p4

I copy the part that helped me:
Open the Device Manager, navigate to your video card, right click and select Update driver software. "Search on my computer for driver software" then - "choose from a list of device drivers on my computer" - "data media" - seeking the Explorer to the previously loaded down the latest drivers are installed. For me this is "C:  AMD  Support  13-1_vista_win7_win8_64_dd_ccc_whql  Packages  Drivers  Display  W86A_INF"

finish the driver installation. Restart the PC and then it goes with me. I hope I could help. if not add me on Steam or post here."

Hope that will work too for those with an AMD graphic card

It works fine in Windows 8 64-Bit after following "EslaMx7"'s instructions. Let me repeat his steps:

"For anyone who faced this error on Win8 64-bit : "the procedure entry point create interface could not be located in the dynamic link library c:GamesFieldRunners 2steam_api.dll" just do the following

1) Install latest version of steam and login with your account : http://store.steampowered.com/about/   (if you don't have an account make a free one!)

2) Go to the steam app folder : C:Program Files(x86)Steam , and copy all DLL files and paste them in the game folder next to the .exe file and overwrite any existing file if it prompts you to do so. "

It's a fun game, and works fine now! 

@ Wankbot31 : I really get annoyed by people like you who complain about other users facing difficutlies in Windows 8. It's a new OS and things work a bit differently. If people need help, then it's fine for them to ask for it. Please don't act like an @sshole and shout at them. The torrent community is supposed to help others with advice and comments. Windows 8 is an amazing OS and far better than any previous versions MS has released. It just takes time to get used to it. (I've been assembling PCs for the last 16 years, so trust me, I know!)

With W8 64b, after solving the dll issue, there is another problem: exiting steam = loosing game save

@netter2k: do you have this issue? did you solve it?

@ cailloup : This might also be another answer. I can't paste the direct link to steam forums as PirateBay doesn't allow it. So I'm gona copy and paste the person's tip here  : 

" I lost all 5 or so achievements i had gotten yesterday and everything was locked again. Browsing on some forums, about this, i found out that the solution is simple: Go to fieldrunners' installation path (right-click on the game on steam>local files tab>browse local files), right click on Fieldrunners.exe and hit properties, go to the "compatibility" tab and check "Run this program as administrator", click Apply, done. 

Now all progress will be saved like it should. Hope it helped!"
